content.p: The circulation of the vector field \mathbf{F}(x,y) = \left\langle {{fx}}, {{fy}} \right\rangle along which of the curves illustrated below is equal to {{circ}}? Explain your answer.

image.description: Vector field with three closed polygonal curves.

outtro.p: Since \dfrac{\partial F_2}{\partial x} - \dfrac{\partial F_1}{\partial y} = {{scurl}}, the appropriate curve is C_{ {{which}} } since \iint_{C_{ {{which}} }} {{scurl}}\, dA = {{circ}}.

content.p: Use Green's theorem to find the counterclockwise circulation of \mathbf{G}(x,y) = \left\langle {{gx}}, {{gy}} \right\rangle around the circle x^2+y^2 = {{r}}.

outtro.p: By Green's theorem this is equal to \iint_{x^2+y^2 \leq {{r}} } {{integrand}} \,dA = {{ans}}.
